intro: Carex longiculmis, commonly known as the long-beaked sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to eastern North America, particularly found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has grass-like leaves that are typically dark green and narrow, with a distinctive long, narrow beak at the tip of its flowering spikes. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, three-ranked spikelets. Carex longiculmis plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
